Ingredients: 

• 1 pound ground beef or Italian sausage (or a combination) 
• 1 medium onion, finely chopped 
• 3 cloves garlic, minced 
• 1 can (28 ounces) crushed tomatoes 
• 1 can (6 ounces) tomato paste 
• 2 teaspoons dried oregano 
• 2 teaspoons dried basil 
• Salt and pepper to taste 
• 2 cups ricotta cheese 
• 1 egg 
• 3 cups shredded mozzarella cheese 
• 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese 
• Fresh basil or parsley, for garnish (optional) 

Procedure: 

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). 
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef or sausage over medium-high heat until browned. Break it into small pieces as it cooks. Remove any excess fat from the pan. 
3. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for a few minutes until they become translucent. 
4. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer the sauce for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. 
5. In a separate bowl, mix the ricotta cheese with one beaten egg. 
6. To assemble the lasagna, spread a small amount of the meat sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish to prevent sticking. 
7. Place three lasagna noodles on top of the sauce. 
8. Spread a layer of the ricotta mixture over the noodles, followed by a layer of the meat sauce and a layer of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. 
9. Repeat the layering process with noodles, ricotta, meat sauce, and cheese. You should have about three layers in total. 
10. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for about 25-30 minutes. 
11. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes until the lasagna is bubbly and the cheese is golden brown. 
12. Let the lasagna rest for about 10 minutes before serving. This helps the layers set, making it easier to cut. 
13. Garnish with fresh basil or parsley, if desired, before serving. 


This recipe should provide enough lasagna for 5 members.
